posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
WoG was offline for a while, so I explored this build idea.

Bard / CoT / RDD is a famous combo, but not many have gone heavy RDD, which has benefits of extra HP, AC and bonus feats.

I thought the best way to make use of these bonus feats is to use them for Epic Damage Reduction x3.

In addition I managed to squeeze in Devastating Critical, Base Strength 40 and Base AB 45 (with 4 APR).

With almost 600hp and +14AC from Tumble 40 and RDD AC, and good saves (F36W26R25), UMD this looks like a bit of a beast.

If you want more saves you could swap the 35 discipline skill points and put them into spellcraft for an extra +7 to saves against spells

Thought it would be a delightful build to play.

If you want more defense then pick weapon focus: katana or bastard sword and pick up a tower shield but I thought a Scythe would look cool with big crits and later on this dude can keen the weapon (like he's sharpening his scythe of death)

Never thought dwarven farmers could be this deadly! 

(Although he doesn't wield the 'sharpest' tool in the book with 10->12 int...)

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I like him a lot.

Just a couple of potential tweaks to consider. I'd think about taking both Blind Fight and Knockdown before taking Power Attack. After all, you have the strength anyway, so you're only taking the feat for its part in the Dev Crit chain really. And max Discipline, don't even think about dropping it - even at the expense of UMD. The only thing worse for a melee build than failing a Will save is ending up on your arse or being disarmed. Those 3 render everything a meleer is designed to do useless - ie, fight. Yes, Spellcraft would be nice - it always is - but not at Disc's expense. Perhaps give your skills schedule a bit more love and attention. I do think you're right to take Epic Prowess rather than Armour Skin here, but it's a possible variant. 

Nicely done!
